skill.name: project-creator
skill.description:
Creates new projects in CCGG Business Operations with all required mechanisms automatically implemented.
Ensures PARENT SYSTEM INTEGRATION, operations logging, strategic alignment, and cross-project intelligence are properly configured.
Handles both simple projects (standard structure) and complex projects (with coordination hubs and dependency tracking).

Use for: creating new incubator project, adding sub-project to CCGG, initializing project structure, setting up project coordination, ensuring PARENT SYSTEM INTEGRATION implemented, generating CLAUDE.md with all mechanisms, creating Active Projects Index entry.

Trigger terms: create project, new project, initialize project, set up project, add sub-project, project structure, CCGG project creation.

skill.author: Daron Vener

security_audit.summary: This is a template-based project creation skill. All static findings are false positives: markdown backticks are code formatting (not shell execution), relative paths are hardcoded template variables (not user input), and validation scripts only read files and output to stdout with no network or credential access.

content.user_title: Create CCGG Business Operations projects instantly
content.value_statement: Manually setting up new projects with standardized mechanisms is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automates project creation with templates, validation checks, and cross-project coordination for CCGG Business Operations.
actual_capabilities: Creates new projects with standardized folder structure
Generates CLAUDE.md with PARENT SYSTEM INTEGRATION
Creates Active Projects Index entries with dependency tracking
Supports simple and complex projects with coordination hubs
Validates all mechanisms are properly implemented
Creates multi-phase project trackers with proactive reminders
limitations: Designed specifically for CCGG Business Operations project structure
Requires manual input for project details (title, purpose, deliverables)
Automated creation script not yet implemented
Does not modify existing projects, only creates new ones

use_cases.title: Standardize New Project Setup
use_cases.description: Create new incubator projects with all required mechanisms pre-configured. Ensures consistency across the project portfolio.

use_cases.title: Multi-Project Coordination
use_cases.description: Set up complex projects with dependency tracking, coordination hubs, and integration checkpoints for cross-project work.

use_cases.title: Phase-Based Project Tracking
use_cases.description: Create multi-phase projects with built-in reminders, completion criteria, and transition prompts between phases.

prompt_templates.title: Simple Project
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new simple project in CCGG Business Operations named [project-name] with purpose: [1-2 sentence purpose]. Deliverables: [list]. No coordination needed.

prompt_templates.title: Complex Project
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new complex project in CCGG Business Operations named [project-name]. Purpose: [description]. This project coordinates with [other projects].

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Phase
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new multi-phase project in CCGG Business Operations named [project-name]. Purpose: [description]. Include [number] phases.

prompt_templates.title: Full Project
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a complete project. Name: [hyphen-case]. Purpose: [description]. Deliverables: [3-5 items]. Avatars: [specific or all]. Dependencies: [upstream/downstream].

output_examples.input: Create a new simple project named member-retention-sequences with purpose: Design email sequences to re-engage churned members. Deliverables: 5 email templates, 3 DM scripts, retention playbook. No coordination needed.

best_practices: Use hyphen-case for project names (e.g., member-retention-sequences)
Specify clear deliverables during project creation (3-5 items)
Determine project complexity upfront: simple for standalone work, complex for multi-project coordination
Validate each new project with the validation script before starting work
anti_patterns: Skipping dependency analysis for complex projects
Using the wrong template (CLAUDE_SIMPLE for standalone, CLAUDE_COMPLEX for coordinated work)
Forgetting to run validation after project creation

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It generates CLAUDE.md files compatible with all Claude-based tools.

faq.question: What is the difference between simple and complex projects?
faq.answer: Simple projects are standalone with no dependencies. Complex projects coordinate with 2+ other projects and require a Coordination Hub folder.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing CCGG Business Operations?
faq.answer: All generated projects include PARENT SYSTEM INTEGRATION sections that connect to operations log, Active Projects Index, and strategic alignment validation.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads templates and writes project files locally. No data is sent externally or stored beyond your project structure.

faq.question: Why is validation failing for my project?
faq.answer: Common issues: missing PARENT SYSTEM INTEGRATION section, unreplaced template variables, missing Active Projects Index entry, or missing operations log entry.

faq.question: How does this compare to other project creation tools?
faq.answer: Unlike generic project starters, this skill enforces CCGG-specific mechanisms: operations logging, strategic alignment checks, dependency tracking, and cross-project intelligence.
